Module lanej.schedulingsystem
Package lanej.schedulingsystem.helper

Class ScreenUtility

java.lang.Object
lanej.schedulingsystem.helper.ScreenUtility
public abstract class ScreenUtility extends Object
Provides utility methods for managing and changing JavaFX scenes. This class simplifies scene transitions and provides alert handling in the application.

  • Method Details

    • changeStageScene

      public static void changeStageScene(javafx.stage.Stage stage, SceneType sceneType) throws IOException
      Changes the scene of the provided stage to the specified SceneType.
      Parameters:
      stage - the stage for which the scene will be changed.
      sceneType - the scene type that defines the new scene details.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there's an issue loading the FXML.

    • changeStageScene

      public static void changeStageScene(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent, SceneType scene)
      Changes the scene of the stage related to the action event to the specified SceneType. Uses the actionEvent as a method of obtaining the parent Stage.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggering the change.
      scene - the scene type that defines the new scene details.

    • alert

      public static void alert(String alertMessage)
      Displays an error alert with the given message.
      Parameters:
      alertMessage - the error message.

    • showInformation

      public static void showInformation(String informationMessage)
      Displays an information alert with the given message.
      Parameters:
      informationMessage - the informational message.

    • showConfirmation

      public static Boolean showConfirmation(String confirmationMessage)
      Displays a confirmation alert and waits for the user's response.
      Parameters:
      confirmationMessage - the message asking for confirmation.
      Returns:
      a Boolean indicating the user's response to the alert.

    • showWarning

      public static Boolean showWarning(String warningMessage)
      Displays a warning alert and waits for the user's response.
      Parameters:
      warningMessage - the warning message.
      Returns:
      a Boolean indicating the user's response to the alert.
